p: To investigate the volatile composition of C. myrrha oil, gas-chromatography/mass spectrometry (GC/MS) technique was used. Twenty-two volatile compounds were identified representing an average of 99.9% of the oil composition and they are listed in Table 2. The most abundant component was furanoeudesma-1,3-dione (31.1%) followed by curzerene (23.1%), germacra-1(10),7,11-trien-15-oic acid, 8,12-epoxy-6-hydroxy-gamma-lactone (14.4%), lindestrene (11.9%) and other minor compounds.
